original_title: Floterian - Hand Printings From a Film History
overview: Sequences from the filmmakers' 16mm, Super 8 and Stand 8 mm work, dating from 1960 onwards, are contact-printed onto 35mm film, then reduced to 16mm for projection. The relationship of the frame sizes of the smaller gauges to that of the 35mm causes a fluttering on the screen which relates to the ephemerality of the memory and the effect on it of the passing of times.  Floterian is an old English word meaning fluttering.
title: Floterian - Hand Printings From a Film History
